5.0 out of 5 starsMuch better than Songs of Innocence.
ByDavid J. Chamberlinon December 1, 2017
Format: MP3 Music
I love that for the most part that they have embraced joy. It’s playful and parts are tongue in cheek (e.g. The Showman). We need it. The world is nuts and not just politically. Some of the songs don’t sound like anything they’ve done before (e.g. The Showman). I know that some reviews have gone after Bono for the lyrics but I feel like he’s pretty brave. He’s very on his sleeve but in an introspective/personal way. He lets it all hang out and he’s not afraid. I don’t see that as playing safe.

1. Love Is All We Have Left – wasn’t expecting this. I like the auto-tune and lyrics. It may grow on me. I like the message. Feels like a call back to the basics of genuine faith.
2. Lights of Home – Love the fuzzy guitar. It has an interesting middle portion and I like the uplift of the choir at the end. Feels like church.I prefer the St Peter's String Version.
3. You’re The Best Thing About Me - I liked it when it first was played live by Kygo.
4. Get Out Of Your Own Way – Has a City of Blinding Lights sound to me. I like that it can be read as a political song and as a song to his daughters or even to himself.
5. American Soul – Great song. My favorite rocker of the album. I like how it points back to Volcano but takes it in a different direction. Crank it up. It’s great in the car.
6. Summer of Love – playful, uplifting. There’s a southern twang to this song. A better version of California (There Is No End to Love). Clearly about Aleppo but the song is still light and uplifting somehow despite the content.
7. Red Flag Day – Sounds like a throw back to me. I like the changes of pace. Edge sounds great. Energetic.
8. Showman – Made me laugh. Bono is light-hearted and cynical at the same time.
9. The Little Things That Give You Away – a much better song on the album than live for me. I always liked the end of the song live but it took so long to get there. For whatever it works better for me here. I love how Edge’s guitar feels like it is about to just let go and how it builds throughout the song. It also feels like a tip of the cap to City of Blinding Lights.
10. The Blackout – I like it. Liked it the first time I heard the live version. That is still my favorite version but this is good.
11. Landlady – Not a favorite of mine but maybe it will grow on me. His songs to Ali don’t usually grab me for whatever reason.
12. Love Is Bigger Than Anything In Its Way – I really like it. It takes on a bit of a spiritual meaning / double entendre. After first listen, I feel like this may a conversation. I wonder if he’s talking to God.
13. 13 – I wasn’t a big fan of Song for Someone but I like how they tie back to the previous album here with the chorus.

Only Love Is All We Have Left , 13 and Book Of Your Heart (love the lyrics though) didn’t really resonate with me but they may grow on me.

5.0 out of 5 starsSolid Release
ByBrahminon December 1, 2017
Format: MP3 Music|Verified Purchase
I'm not someone who has been overly into U2's output since All That You Can't Leave Behind. That said, I always check it out and there are always at least a handful of songs that make each album worth the listen. I read a lot of reviews before picking this album up and by god some of them were harsh. I put on my headphones and took a listen, expecting the worst. I have to say, even on first listen I really enjoyed this one and that has already grown a bit over 24 hours. The bonus tracks even add to it. Enjoyed the whole thing. If I were being truly honest I'd probably give this four stars, but I'm handicapping my rating for the folks who will come on here having listened to half of a couple songs and then trashed it like they already knew they would.

5.0 out of 5 stars"Songs of Experience" (Deluxe) is great.
ByKris Kingon December 1, 2017
Format: MP3 Music
"Songs of Experience" (Deluxe) is great. This is another great album from U2. It is solid, well-done and entertaining. This is one of the best rock albums of the year and also one of the best albums of the year, as well. All (17) tracks on here are great.

5.0 out of 5 starsThe Band's Best Qualities
BySadie Lydon Front Row Centeron December 2, 2017
Format: MP3 Music|Verified Purchase
I've been following them since 1980 when I was in search of something in the post-punk days, and they've never disappointed. When you're a fan, when you love a band you stick with them through their experimentation. When you do that the value becomes evident. The tracks on this album don't define the moment as much as they gather the things we like best about this band and put them on display once again. Maybe what people like about U2 changes with each person but after listening to Songs of Experience, and most especially the deluxe edition, I hear it all here.
